items.title: Exercise 1: Audit Report Summary (Doc A)
items.text:
Doc A â€” Internal Quality Audit Summary

Scope: Administrative Support Processes
Audit Date: 12th February

Key Findings:
- The 'Travel Booking' process was found to have a significant bottleneck in the final approval stage, which currently takes 48 hours.
- Not only did the audit identify delays, but it also highlighted a lack of compliance with the latest data privacy standards during vendor vetting.
- One non-conformity was recorded regarding the storage of physical client files.

Corrective Actions:
1. Streamline the approval workflow using the new automated portal.
2. Conduct a training session on 'Data Minimisation' for all admin staff by Friday EOD.
3. Implement a 'Clean Desk' policy to adhere to ISO 9001 standards.

Rarely has the team been so responsive to feedback; we expect all issues to be resolved within the next sprint.

questions.question: What is the primary bottleneck identified in the Travel Booking process?
questions.explanation: Doc A states there is a 'significant bottleneck in the final approval stage'.

questions.question: What standard is the team trying to adhere to with the 'Clean Desk' policy?
questions.explanation: Doc A mentions the policy is to 'adhere to ISO 9001 standards'.

items.prompt: Exercise 2: QMS Principles. What is the Japanese term for 'Continuous Improvement' used in QMS?
items.explanation: Kaizen is the Japanese term for continuous improvement.

items.prompt: Exercise 3: The PDCA Cycle. Which stage involve implementing the change on a small scale to test its effectiveness?
items.explanation: In the 'Do' stage, you test the improvement on a small scale.

items.prompt: Exercise 4: Operational Chunks. Complete the sentence: 'We need to ___ the process to eliminate this ___.'
items.explanation: The standard professional goal is to 'streamline a process' and 'eliminate a bottleneck'.

items.prompt: Exercise 5: Inversion for Emphasis. Rewrite this sentence starting with 'Never': 'We have never seen such a high level of non-conformity in this department.'
items.modelAnswer: Never have we seen such a high level of non-conformity in this department.

items.prompt: Exercise 6: Inversion (Not only). Rewrite this sentence starting with 'Not only': 'The new system reduces paper waste and it also speeds up approvals.'
items.modelAnswer: Not only does the new system reduce paper waste, but it also speeds up approvals.

items.prompt: Exercise 7: Extracting Action Points. Based on Doc A, list the 3 corrective actions that must be taken.
items.modelAnswer:
1. Streamline the approval workflow via the portal.
2. Conduct a 'Data Minimisation' training session.
3. Implement a 'Clean Desk' policy.

items.prompt: Exercise 8: Courtesy Modals. How would you professionally suggest a process improvement to your manager?
options: This process is bad, change it.
Why are we doing it this way?
Would you be open to exploring a more streamlined approach for our travel bookings?
I'm going to change the process now.
items.explanation: Using 'Would you be open to...' is a diplomatic and professional way to propose changes in a UK business context.

items.prompt: Exercise 9: Follow-up Email. Write a short email (45-65 words) to the team informing them that an internal audit will take place on Wednesday and that everyone must ensure they are in compliance with the 'Clean Desk' policy.
items.modelAnswer: Hi team, please be advised that we will be conducting an internal quality audit this Wednesday morning. To ensure we are in full compliance with ISO 9001, could everyone please double-check that they are adhering to the 'Clean Desk' policy before EOD tomorrow? Thanks, [Your Name]

items.prompt: Exercise 10: Non-conformity. What is the correct term for 'a failure to meet a specified requirement'?
items.explanation: In QMS terminology, failing a requirement is called a 'non-conformity'.

items.prompt: Exercise 11: Oral Briefing. Record a 2-minute audio briefing explaining the PDCA cycle to a new intern. Use inversion once for emphasis (e.g., 'Not only...').
items.modelAnswer: [Audio Upload Required] Rubric: Clarity, Explanation of Plan-Do-Check-Act, Use of Inversion.

items.prompt: Exercise 12: Oral Audit Feedback. Record a 60-second summary of an audit finding. Use 'Under no circumstances' to emphasize a security rule.
items.modelAnswer: [Audio Upload Required] Checklist: Identification of non-conformity, Use of 'Under no circumstances', Professional tone.

items.prompt: Exercise 13: Process Improvement Proposal (Portfolio). Draft a 150-word proposal to streamline the 'Office Supplies Ordering' process. Use PDCA and at least two examples of inversion.
items.modelAnswer:
Process Improvement Proposal: Stationery Procurement

Current Situation: The current manual ordering process is inefficient. Seldom has the department received orders on time due to paper-based approvals causing a major bottleneck.

Proposed Solution (PDCA):
1. Plan: Switch to a digital 'E-Procurement' portal.
2. Do: Run a pilot with the Admin team for two weeks.
3. Check: Monitor delivery times and user feedback.
4. Act: Roll out the portal to the whole office.

Emphasis: Not only will this reduce processing time, but it will also ensure we are in compliance with budget tracking. Under no circumstances should manual orders be placed after the portal goes live on the 1st of next month.

items.prompt: Exercise 14: Audit Non-Conformity Log. Complete a log entry for a non-conformity. Include: Description, Requirement Not Met, Root Cause, and Corrective Action.
items.modelAnswer: Description: Employee passwords found on sticky notes. Requirement: ISO 27001 / GDPR security protocols. Root Cause: Lack of awareness regarding digital security. Corrective Action: Mandatory security training and implementation of a password manager.

items.prompt: Exercise 15: Weekly Mini-test. 1) Define 'Streamline'. 2) What does PDCA stand for? 3) Complete the inversion: 'Seldom ___ we had such positive audit results.' 4) What is the difference between a bottleneck and a non-conformity?
items.modelAnswer: 1) To make a process more efficient by simplifying it. 2) Plan-Do-Check-Act. 3) ...have... 4) A bottleneck is a delay/congestion; a non-conformity is a failure to meet a standard.
